code: @Manual{,   title = {animbook: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Krisanat Anukarnsakulchularp},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/KrisanatA/animbook}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: “animbook” package help user visualize movement observations time. package help prep data, plot, animate.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version animbook GitHub :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: using dataset provided package osiris. three stages package users need follow.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: stage, first need prepare data structure specific format. function assign frame, calculate scaling, create necessary data settings next stage. data needs contain following variable function work: id: firmID, needs factor variable. values: sales, need numeric variable. time: year, needs integer variable. also additional options allow user customize. label: group labeling. ngroup: number groups want split values . breaks: group bins size (prototype) group_scaling: grouping variable bins calculations. color: variable used color observations. time_dependent: logical. Whether want observations start time . scaling: scaling method, either rank absolute. runif_min: minimum value random addition frame numbers runif_max: maximum value random addition frame numbers function can calculate four different scales using options. function return animbook object containing list formatted data settings.
code: animbook <- anim_prep(osiris, firmID, sales, year) # rank scaling rank_scaling <- anim_prep(data = osiris, id = firmID, values = sales, time = year)  # absolute scaling absolute_scaling <- anim_prep(data = osiris, id = firmID, values = sales, time = year,                               scaling = "absolute")  # rank scaling by group rank_group_scaling <- anim_prep(data = osiris, id = firmID, values = sales, time = year,                                  group = country)  # absolute scaling by group absolute_group_scaling <- anim_prep(data = osiris, id = firmID, values = sales, time = year,                                     group = country, scaling = "absolute")  rank_scaling #> $data #> # A tibble: 10,270 × 4 #>    id                              time qtile frame #>    <fct>                          <int> <dbl> <int> #>  1 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2006     2     1 #>  2 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2007     2     2 #>  3 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2008     2     3 #>  4 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2009     2     4 #>  5 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2010     2     5 #>  6 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2011     2     6 #>  7 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2012     0     7 #>  8 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2013     0     8 #>  9 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2014     0     9 #> 10 1&1 VERSATEL GMBH DE2011730431  2015     0    10 #> # ℹ 10,260 more rows #>  #> $settings #> $settings$gap #> [1] 1.2 #>  #> $settings$xbreaks #>  [1] 2006 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 #>  #> $settings$label #> [1] "5" "4" "3" "2" "1" "0" #>  #> $settings$scaling #>   0%  20%  40%  60%  80% 100%  #>    1   93  185  277  369  567  #>  #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "animbook"

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: preparing data, can plot . three plots available package: kangaroo, plots observation’s movement time. wallaby, subset plot either top bottom see group observational period. funnel_web_spider, faceted plot time variable.    kangaroo wallaby plots can animated using function next stage. funnel_web_spider supported static plot. can also choose whether want animate plot using gganimate plotly.
code: animbook <- anim_prep(data = osiris, id = firmID, values = sales, time = year, color = japan)  # kangaroo plot anim_plot(animbook, plot = "kangaroo") # wallaby plot anim_plot(animbook, plot = "wallaby") # funnel web spider plot anim_plot(animbook, plot = "funnel_web_spider")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: animate plot, need save plot object, can passed function.
code: animbook <- anim_prep(data = osiris, id = firmID, values = sales, time = year, color = japan)  p <- anim_plot(animbook, plot = "wallaby", width = 0.01)  p2 <- anim_animate(p) #> You can now pass it to gganimate::animate()  gganimate::animate(p2)

title: Australian election study data — aeles
text: aes dataset contains answer surveys done 2019 election. dataset includes id, year, party, gender full survey data. year column come transformations two different question see whether voter voted party 2016 2019 voted .

what: Turn the data into ggplot object for animate function — anim_plot
title: Turn the data into ggplot object for animate function — anim_plot
text: function take data prepared anim_prep() return ggplot object. user can still modified plot normal.

title: Turn the data into ggplot object for animate function — anim_plot
code: anim_plot(   object,   plot = "kangaroo",   palette = RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(9, "Set1"),   rendering = "ggplot",   ... )

title: Turn the data into ggplot object for animate function — anim_plot
text: object data frame prepared anim_prep() plot type plot generate. Choose "kangaroo," "wallaby," "funnel_web_spider." palette vector palette used function supplied color group. rendering choice method used create display plot, either gganimate plotly. ... Additional arguments customization.

title: Turn the data into ggplot object for animate function — anim_plot
text: Return ggplot object

title: Turn the data into ggplot object for animate function — anim_plot
text: function takes prepared data generates ggplot object. Users can specify type plot create ("kangaroo," "wallaby," "funnel_web_spider") customize appearance plot using additional arguments.

title: Turn the data into ggplot object for animate function — anim_plot
code: animbook <- anim_prep(data = osiris, id = firmID, values = sales, time = year, color = japan)  anim_plot(animbook)

what: Prepare Data for Animated Visualizations — anim_prep
title: Prepare Data for Animated Visualizations — anim_prep
text: function prepares data format anim_plot() required assigning frames, grouping data, scaling values, creating necessary data settings anim_plot() function.

title: Prepare Data for Animated Visualizations — anim_prep
code: anim_prep(   data,   id = NULL,   values = NULL,   time = NULL,   label = NULL,   ngroup = 5L,   breaks = NULL,   group_scaling = NULL,   color = NULL,   time_dependent = TRUE,   scaling = "rank",   runif_min = 1,   runif_max = 50 )

title: Prepare Data for Animated Visualizations — anim_prep
text: data data frame containing data prepared visualization. id column name represents unique identifier variable. values column name contains numeric values visualized. time column name representing time variable. label vector labels used y-axis visualization. ngroup number groups categories create scaling values. breaks vector breaks creating bins using absolute scaling. group_scaling column name represents grouping variable. color column name used aes() anim_plot(). time_dependent Logical. visualization time-dependent? Default TRUE. scaling scaling method used: "rank" "absolute". runif_min minimum value random addition frame numbers. runif_max maximum value random addition frame numbers.

title: Prepare Data for Animated Visualizations — anim_prep
text: animbook object: data data frame prepared data visualization. settings list settings used anim_plot(), including data, gap, xbreaks, label scaling.

title: Prepare Data for Animated Visualizations — anim_prep
text: function takes input data performs several operations prepare visualizations. assigns frames, groups data, scales values, creates necessary data settings anim_plot() function.

title: Prepare Data for Animated Visualizations — anim_prep

title: Osiris firm sales data — osiris
text: Osiris dataset contains information listed, major unlisted/delisted companies across world 2006 2018. dataset includes year, ID, country, sales, japan variables full Osiris dataset give user example dataset format.

title: Osiris firm sales data — osiris
text: data frame 10,270 rows 5 variables year Year ID BvD(Bureau van Dijk) ID country Address incorp. - Country sales Sales japan Whether firm froom Japan

title: Osiris firm sales data — osiris
text: dataset following; Bureau van Dijk https://www.bvdinfo.com/en-gb/-products/data/international/osiris.

title: Animate sigmoid path — sigmoid
text: function create path starting point (x_start, y_start) ending point (x_end, y_end) sigmoid shape.

title: Animate sigmoid path — sigmoid
code: sigmoid(x_start = 0, x_end = 1, y_start = 0, y_end = 1, scale = 5, n = 100)

title: Animate sigmoid path — sigmoid
text: x_start x-coordinate starting point. x_end x-coordinate ending point. y_start y-coordinate starting point. y_end y-coordinate ending point. scale numeric value controls length sigmoid. n numeric value controls number points starting ending points.

title: Animate sigmoid path — sigmoid
text: Return path data frame format

title: Animate sigmoid path — sigmoid
text: Recreate - Sankey flow chart. (n.d.). Emil Hvitfeldt. Retrieved April 13, 2023, https://www.emilhvitfeldt.com/post/2018-03-20-recreate-sankey-flow-chart/

title: Animate sigmoid path — sigmoid
code: path <- sigmoid()  ggplot2::ggplot(data = path, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) + ggplot2::geom_point()
